basics.name: Gonzalo Quero Diez
basics.label: Full Stack Developer
basics.summary: Web, videogame, and VFX software developer

location.address:
Calle Peral 5, Bajo Derecha
41702 Dos Hermanas (Sevilla) - Spain

highlights: Rewrote an automatic project sheet summarizer, making it easier to use and 10x faster (C#)
Optimized the client database so that we could make searches in a reasonable amount of time (SQL Server)
Wrote a workshop planner and a tool that ensured a fair assignment of students to the workshops they had to attend (Django)
Wrote tools to help split our main TV programme (La Semana Más Larga) in 15 minute sections to fit YouTube restrictions (Ruby)
Wrote a web for our programme, with connection to YouTube's API to automatically publish new episodes (Ruby on Rails)
Built and controlled a render farm for a 45 minute animation project (3ds Max, Networking)
Developed a successful videogame with more than a million downloads: Which Is The Real One? - For iOS and Android (Unity3D)
Developed other games, like The Last Contact (Unity3D)
Developed a full management system for Canitas, an animal health insurance company. It manages client information, medical data, and appointments for 4 clinics (Ruby on Rails)
Developed a tool to simulate growth of a tree for a projection mapping in Donostia (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bRgmZ0CChgU - 4:06) (MAXScript)
Tasked with finding new business areas to expand
Developed a VR mobile app for Noteges (http://www.noteges.com). This tool shows images of buildings in 360º to help real estate salespeople show them to their clients (Unity3D + THREE.js)
Developed a synchronized mobile video player for a Noteges event (Unity3D)
Developed BeatDefense, a rhythm mobile game (Unity3D)
Developed SacaEntradas.com, a complete event ticket selling system with an automatically generated theatre seat map, and a ticket validation app (Django + React + React Native)
Developed software that allowed us to produce more than 10 minutes of animation and VFX for DotParty 2015 in less than three weeks (Unreal Engine 4)
